Instance.description: A numerical attribute that can represent a wide variety of statistics.

Tunable.name: apply_value_to_object_cost
Tunable.description: Whether the value of this statistic should be added to the value of the owner of statistic. Affects the price when sold.

TunableEnum.name: gallery_load_behavior
TunableEnum.description: When owner of commodity is loaded from the gallery, tune this to determine if commodity should be loaded or not. DONT_LOAD = Don't load statistic when owner is coming from gallery LOAD_ONLY_FOR_OBJECT = Load only if statistic is being added to an object. If this statistic is tuned as a linked stat to a state, make sure the state is also marked as gallery persisted. i.e. Statistics like fish_freshness or gardening_groth. Switching on this bit has performance implications when downloading a lot from the gallery. Please discuss with a GPE when setting this tunable. LOAD_ONLY_FOR_SIM = Load only if statistic is being added to a sim. LOAD_FOR_ALL = Always load commodity. This has the same ramifications as LOAD_ONLY_FOR_OBJECT if owner is an object.

Tunable.name: icon
Tunable.description: Icon to be displayed for the Statistic.

TunableTuple.name: initial_tuning
TunableTuple.description: The Initial value for this statistic. Can either be a single value, range, or use auto satisfy curve to determine initial value. Range value will take precedence over single value range.

Tunable.name: _initial_value
Tunable.description: The initial value for this stat.

Tunable.name: _use_stat_value_on_init
Tunable.description: If enabled, we will use the initial tuning to set the statistic in the place of other systems (like states). Otherwise, those states or systems will set the initial value of the statistic (a state linked to this stat for example, will set the statistic to whatever default tuning is on the state). TLDR: If checked, the statistic sets the state. Otherwise, the state sets up this statistic. Note: If unchecked, we error if any initial values are tuned as they imply that we want to use them.

TunableVariant.name: _value_range
TunableVariant.description: If enabled then when we first add this statistic to an object, the initial value of the statistic will be set to a random value within this interval.

TunableTuple.name: enabled
TunableTuple.description: An interval that will be used for the initial value of this statistic.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: max_value_tuning
Tunable.description: The maximum value that this statistic can reach.

TunableEnum.name: min_lod_value
TunableEnum.description: The minimum Sim info LOD necessary for this information to persist on the sim info. e.g. A statistic tuned to FULL will not persist on sims that are lower than FULL. LOD order, high to low, is FULL, INTERACTED, BASE, BACKGROUND, MINIMUM.

Tunable.name: min_value_tuning
Tunable.description: The minimum value that this statistic can reach.

Tunable.name: persisted_tuning
Tunable.description: Whether this statistic will persist when saving a Sim or an object. For example, a Sims's SI score statistic should never persist.

Tunable.name: respect_lod_on_add
Tunable.description: If enabled then we will not add the statistic if the LOD value of the Sim is lower than the required LOD of the statistic. Otherwise instanced Sims will be allowed to get statistics of higher LOD values.

TunableTuple.name: stat_asm_param
TunableTuple.description: Tuning that defines how this skill and the various skill levels are set on animations played by the Sim. If an animator wants to play different clips to indicate skill progression, use this tuning to pass that data to the ASM. If the clips are part of an interaction ASM, you can tune the 'Animation Stat' field on the SI to determine which skill is used to represent progression. If the clips are part of various types of ASMs, such as posture transitions or 'Get/Put' animations, check the 'Always Apply' checkbox, which will always set the paramter on all animations played by the Sim. If doing so, ensure the parameter name is unique, i.e. includes the skill's name.

Tunable.name: always_apply
Tunable.description: If checked, this parameter is always applied on any ASM involving the owning Sim.

TunableList.name: level_ranges
TunableList.description: The value mapping of the stat range to stat value or user value. If use_user_value is True, the range should be user value, otherwise stat value.

Tunable.name: key
Tunable.description: The asm parameter for Sim's stat level.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: Stat value fall into the range (inclusive).

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: use_user_value
Tunable.description: Whether use the user value or stat value to decide the asm_param.

Tunable.name: telemetry
Tunable.description: If enabled then we will support telemetry (GAME:STAT:CHNG) for when statistic is changed. For continuous statistics, will be sent when statistic gets updated.
